Body:
"figurine" means "little figure".

From etymonline:

figurine (n.) [Look up figurine at Dictionary.com] 1854, from French figurine (16c.), from Italian figurina, diminutive of figura, from Latin figura (see figure (n.)).

So what is the postfix that makes "figurine" diminutive of "figure"? Are there other examples with the same 'diminutive' postfix as "figurine"?
Title: What is the postfix that makes "figurine" diminutive of "figure"?

LastEditedUser.AboutMe:
Travelling armchair linguist.

Never studied in an institution but read books and web with probably more breadth than depth.

Always on the road surviving in a strange foreign language, currently Mongolian and Mandarin Chinese.

And I collect dictionaries.

OwnerUser.AboutMe:
Just a curious self-learner.

Thanks for your enlightenment!
